alert.note: Alert for Scotts Bluff; Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 23 at 5:58PM CDT until June 23 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern Scotts Bluff County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Southwestern Sioux County in the Panhandle of Nebraska... Central Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming... Southeastern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming... * Until 545 PM MDT. * At 458 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles northeast of Slater, or 17 miles southeast of Wheatland, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Torrington, Morrill, Lingle, Lyman, Fort Laramie, Yoder, Huntley, Bordeaux, Stegall, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Slater, Grayrocks Reservoir, Veteran, Henry and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 57 and 74. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska...and southeastern Wyoming.
